TEXT: The applicant is an NORP national , born in DATE and living in PERSON . She is represented before the Court by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) started preliminary investigations ( file number CARDINAL ORG ) against the applicant and CARDINAL other suspects on suspicion of large - scale fraud and breach of trust in the context of investments in a real estate fund . They were suspected of having sold so called “ partial house ownership certificates ” to CARDINAL investors with the assurance that their value was secured by real property , while in fact they had sold the real property in DATE and misappropriated the proceeds of the sale .

On DATE a search was carried out at the applicant ’s premises and on CARDINAL DATE she was heard as a suspect . Later she fled to GPE with her life companion who was also a suspect in the proceedings .

As of DATE the investigating judge was relieved of all other business and CARDINAL junior judges completing their training period ( Richteramtsanwärter ) were assigned to assist him . In DATE CARDINAL of them took over as the new investigating judge .

During the preliminary investigations , which concerned a network of CARDINAL firms , CARDINAL bank accounts were examined and CARDINAL volumes of documents were seized and studied . A special computer programme was designed in order to cope with the large volume of data . Most of the time was consumed by the preparation of an expert opinion , whereby the team of accounting experts first had to clarify the balance sheets of the companies , most of which were intertwined . A change in the team of experts became necessary in DATE due to the potential bias of some of its members . In DATE the experts delivered their opinion .
On DATE ORG , upon ORG request , issued an international arrest warrant against the applicant .
On DATE the applicant was arrested in the GPE and , on DATE , she was extradited to GPE where she was remanded in custody .

On DATE the applicant was released on bail with a surety of CARDINAL NORP schillings ( ORG ) and the withdrawal of her passport . Upon the applicant ’s request , ORG reduced the amount of the surety to ORG CARDINAL on DATE . It also decided that her passport be returned and ordered the applicant to report to the court at regular intervals . On DATE the applicant requested the court to lift all measures imposed on her , which request was granted on CARDINAL DATE .
On DATE the proceedings against CARDINAL co - accused , against whom the indictment comprising CARDINAL pages had been preferred , were severed from the proceedings concerning the applicant .

On DATE the preliminary investigations were closed and the file was sent to ORG for a decision under LAW of LAW ( Strafprozessordnung ) , according to which ORG has to decide within DATE whether the proceedings are to be discontinued , whether they need to be supplemented or whether an indictment is to be preferred . No indictment was preferred within the prescribed time - limit since ORG , due to the complexity of the case , had filed several applications for supplementing the preliminary investigations . In order to comply with these applications , the preliminary investigations were re - opened .

On DATE the applicant informed the court of ORG failure to take a decision under section CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure within the time - limit and requested the court to inform ORG ( PERSON ) pursuant to LAW of LAW . However , the court did not comply with this request .
On DATE all applications by ORG were complied with and the preliminary investigations under file number CARDINAL Vr CARDINAL were closed . So far ORG has not taken a decision under LAW of LAW .

On DATE the investigating judge granted ORG request of CARDINAL DATE to extend and supplement the above preliminary proceedings as regards one set of facts . These proceedings were conducted under a new file number ( CARDINAL Vr CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) . These further preliminary investigations were closed on DATE and the file was sent to ORG for a decision under section CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure . So far no decision has been taken .

It appears that a further set of preliminary investigations concerning related charges ( number CARDINAL Vr CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) against the applicant and other suspects , which was opened in DATE , is still pending on the ground that CARDINAL expert has not yet completed his opinion .
Section CARDINAL of LAW ( PERSON ) , which has been in force since DATE , provides as follows .

" ( CARDINAL ) If a court is dilatory in taking any procedural step , such as announcing or holding a hearing , obtaining an expert ’s report , or preparing a decision , any party may submit a request to this court for the superior court to impose an appropriate time - limit for the taking of the particular procedural step ; unless sub - section ( CARDINAL ) of this section applies , the court is required to submit the request to the superior court , together with its comments , forthwith .

( CARDINAL ) If the court takes all the procedural steps specified in the request within DATE after receipt , and so informs the party concerned , the request is deemed withdrawn unless the party declares within DATE after service of the notification that it wishes to maintain its request .

( CARDINAL ) The request referred to in sub - section ( CARDINAL ) shall be determined with special expedition by a chamber of the superior court consisting of CARDINAL professional judges , CARDINAL of whom shall preside ; if the court has not been dilatory , the request shall be dismissed . This decision is not subject to appeal . "
Section CARDINAL of the Courts Act applies to all kind of proceedings before the ordinary courts , be it civil or criminal ones .
